Hello and welcome to the <#959960606729977986> channel <:nfteth:822186186016948314> 

Feel free to reach out to the Lens Team at any point with your questions! 

Just giving you all a quick snapshot for you to get quickly acquainted!


üëÄ **ABOUT** 
**Lens Protocol** is a composable and decentralized social graph, ready for you to build on so you can focus on creating a great experience, not scaling your users. 

It's a user-owned, open social graph that any application can plug into. Each application using Lens benefits the whole ecosystem, turning the zero-sum game into a collaborative one. Developers can focus on crafting an excellent experience for their users and leave the growth hacking to the protocol!

Read more here: https://lens.dev/


üèÜ **PRIZE OVERVIEW **

ü•á $6K for first prize
ü•à $2K for second prize

Hello and welcome to the <#959960606729977986> channel <:nfteth:822186186016948314> 

Feel free to reach out to the Lens Team at any point with your questions! 

Just giving you all a quick snapshot for you to get quickly acquainted!


üëÄ **ABOUT** 
The **Aave Companies** are a group of software development companies that build open-source blockchain-based software. To date, they are best known for having built the Aave Protocol, a decentralized, non-custodial liquidity protocol. At its peak, the Aave Protocol has reached over $30B TVL (total value locked). Aave V3 launched in March 2022.

Continuing to build on their vision of creating paradigm-shifting web3 software, the Aave Companies recently launched the **Lens Protocol**, a composable and decentralized social graph, in May 2022. Lens Protocol is designed to empower creators to own the links between themselves and their community, forming a fully composable, user-owned social graph.

Hey! 
We are working on a hack called BlockFuse. The problems we are solving:

- Web2 recruitment solutions are not user-friendly
- They‚Äôre expensive
- They‚Äôre not suited for web3 candidates
- It‚Äôs hard for candidates to prove skill
- It‚Äôs difficult for recruiters to verify talent. 

BlockFuse revolutionizes the recruitment process in web3 by providing the infrastructure for educators, recruiters, and candidates to mint and aggregate proof-of-skill badges with the rest of your professional identity.

We‚Äôre looking for hiring managers, recruiters, job seekers or anyone who is currently working in web3 to complete a short, 5 minute survey to help us refine our solution. https://forms.gle/NBWzVqRbJoTEtsrL6

Thank you in advance, 
Shannon & the BlockFuse team ‚ò∫Ô∏è
We have some hackers that would love to use Tatum & Lens. I am with Tatum; if someone from Lens is here. I would love to chat.

There is apparently problem with the GraphQL API at least on mumbai, we have tried to deploy our own Graph but still it doesn't have the same functionalities

transactions go through on the chain, but they are not being indexed
It looks like everything using testnet lens is dead in the water
https://tenor.com/view/disney-plus-disney-sad-sad-eyes-sad-face-gif-15549594
goodbye victory

OK so I heard from the Lens team that there was an issue with a provider they were using, Alchemy, and they already have plans to minimize dependencies on third parties like these to prevent issues in the future.

Still, despite all the issues, I'm proud of the project and the functionality we were still able to implement and show with Lens. Check it out here: https://ethglobal.com/showcase/podcha-xptrv. We are using Lens Protocol to store the Podcast Profile NFTs, podcast episodes (as Lens Posts) and we are directly interacting with the smart contracts as well as using the Lens API. We are using both the Follow as well as the Collect module to model different kinds of monetization of the podcast resp. episode content.

`attributes: PublicationMetadataAttribute[];`

let's say for example I add an object on the attributes list like

Hmm I think if you use tags on metadata V2 it should be queriable

```
on the cards super soon! you do have metadata v2 which allows you to tag stuff etc and searchable across all publication endpoints. Full search on everything will be coming though!
```
From Josh, our Lens API Lead dev, on the Lens server a few days ago

```
Ability to tag dynamically on a publication, this will allow you to do queries on these tags throughout the API.

    can not have more than 5 tags per publication or it will be rejected
    each tag char length can be no more then 50

```
From the Lens API docs, in the metadata section
src: https://docs.lens.xyz/docs/metadata-standards

Hello and welcome to the <#959960606729977986> channel <:nfteth:822186186016948314>

Just giving you all a quick snapshot for you to get quickly acquainted!


üëÄ **ABOUT** 
**Lens Protocol** is a composable and decentralized social graph. It lets creators take ownership of their content wherever they go in the digital garden of the decentralized internet. With Lens Protocol, you are in control. You own your profile, where you use it, how you use it, and even how you monetize it. That means you have the power over your content, and it‚Äôs all right there, as an NFT, in your wallet. It‚Äôs not just easy. It‚Äôs how digital identity should be: yours.

<@533994454391062529> my postWithSig is going through but i'm not receiving an NFT back, does this mean there is some typer error with the post args?
It is yes! We want this to be very focused
Definetly that would be the case
yes you have the sources parameter
for example
where you put your appid
profiles are site agnostic. what you mean?
yes we do that

ok, what im confused about tho is that apparently when doing publication post type you don't actually mint an nft until someone collects something... it just gets indexed with "lens" ..... so then why would i also be getting an nft? which one is correct....
correct. the publications are not nft's
the follows and collects are nft's, also profiles
so why do i need to write to the contract when i post? in the docs it shows calling the contract with postWithSig
am i indexing on-chain in that case? ... but the docs mention the indexer is just the lens api
im also a bit confused how come u mentioned i should receive an nft back on postWithSig... when at the same time post types don't have nfts?
you shouldn't expect an nft back from posting. sorry for the confusion
ok  got it, so i check if it's gone through via querying index?
yeah success response from API and then get's indexed
ok i got a success repsonse but false for index
it's not instant
allow for a little delay

i get this error on my args from tx response: `TypeError: 'caller', 'callee', and 'arguments' properties may not be accessed on strict mode functions or the arguments objects for calls to them
    at Function.invokeGetter (<anonymous>:3:28)`

i'm not in strict mode ... so i'm wondering if it's something wrong with my args
or if there is a better way to test? for example, if it does index successfully, should it show up on lenster testnet?
pls for more  bugs or errors  use the lens discord channel
alright .
the better way to test is to assume the transaction will go throught. Optimistic mindset üôÇ
but you have to allow for the delay to see it with your eyes
.... totally disagree... it's a dark forest .. building in blockchain is all about assuming you are dealing with bad actors and preparing for it.
i am fully optimistic in the world that we can build, but that has to recognise that the current world is on fire.
i understand your point of view, but we need to build optimistic user experiences
we can't wait for the validators to reach consensus when we make a follow or post an image

actually i was writing just about this https://medium.com/@fabriguespe/optimistic-uis-3dac0a0ff098
what do you think?
cool. i will read this tonight
that's the idea around fast publishing üôÇ fast publishing means optimistic publishing also
it's like the trilemma issue , we are focusing on user experience and  the 99.9% of use cases
if something goes wrong we will get a rollback but not much, it;'s not financial assets.
thinking out loud here
https://docs.lens.xyz/docs/has-transaction-been-indexed
we advise await pollUntilIndexed(txHash); doing in the background

interesting take, where i struggle to agree, is how it's similar to when people say we don't need decentralisation... it doesn't matter until it does. Of course as you mention there is essentially  maybe "less" on the line, at the same time, if we make that assumption we might find ourselves rapidly back where web2 has taken us
it shouldn't be up to us to decide what's of heavier value: financial content, social content or any other form of creative transaction

maximising decentralisation lets the edges of the network (the users) decide. We are not going to get 100% decentralisation out of the box, but there is a reason why I don't have any interest in developing on Flow or Solana

the balance between maximising the experience and maximising how bullet proof the decentralisation of the tech layer really is can be less of a stark trade off if we put more time into thinking things through in a dark forest design approach
i guess what i'm trying to say it's a really bad user experience to have what you think you own get lost or destroyed or stolen because the system broke down

Hi everyone, so excited for the hackathon this week!

If you're interested in learning more about Lens or the Lens bounties, this thread is a great place to start:
https://twitter.com/LensProtocol/status/1646294369471991810

Here are a great set of resources to get started building:
https://twitter.com/LensProtocol/status/1646294456205967360

If you have any questions, feel free to drop a question here or reach out to me on Telegram at `@naderdabit`

Me and Jess from the DevRel team will be around the venue over the next 3 days and will be happy to answer questions or help you in any way, so definitely come find us ü´°

Also if you're hacking, be sure to stop by the booth, let us know what you're building, and pick up some swag!

hello everyone!

We're a team of 2, thinking to build a simple dapp that makes it easy and effortless to leverage the value of your networking efforts on an event or hackathon just like this one !

The idea is to use the dapp to connect with people you meet, so at its core its a social app and thus we decided to build on Lens network to leverage interoperability & composability with other social platforms.

Interested to see what else will people be building on Lens in ETHTokyo, identifying overlaps early might lead to either team to pivot or even merge üôÇ

Hey Lens frens! Missed the in-person presentation so posting here.

For ETHTokyo I built a Lens interface with profile lookups and authentication, with support for all three deployed instances of the protocol (Polygon PoS, Polygon Mumbai, and Sandbox Polygon Mumbai).

I also added first-class support for Lens handles across all address inputs in the interface - you can type any Lens handle (e.g. stani.lens) and it will automatically resolve to the owner's address if it makes sense for the given context.

I just scratched the surface of the Lens API this weekend and hope to dive even deeper for future events!

Check it out:
https://blockhead.info/apps/lens
https://ethglobal.com/showcase/blockhead-ethtokyo-2023-kx4rh
hey, awesome work!!! this looks really great

Hello and welcome to the <#959960606729977986> channel <:nfteth:822186186016948314>

Feel free to reach out to the Lens Protocol Team at any point with your questions!

üëÄ **ABOUT**
**Lens Protocol**¬†is the social layer for web3.

The Lens social graph enables creators to take ownership of their content wherever they go across the dozens of high quality apps across the Ecosystem, with new ones coming online every month.

With Lens, you can easily build social applications or integrate social features into your existing applications. For developers, one of Lens' most powerful features is that it eliminates the need to build, maintain and pay for back-end infrastructure, allowing developers to focus 100% on building the consumer experience.

Teams with as few as 1 developer are able to build polished experiences on Lens using the variety of APIs and SDKs available to builders.


üèÜ **PRIZE OVERVIEW**

ü•á$3,500 USDC - Prize for best social web or mobile application built on Lens.

ü•â$1,500 USDC - Prize for third best social web or mobile application built on Lens.

We are trying to unfollow multiple people at the same time. Since every follow is represented by an NFT in your wallet, we understood that to unfollow someone you have to burn the matching NFT.
We also found out that each creator has his own Follow-NFT collection, which means if someone is following 5 people he is going to have 5 different NFTs from 5 different collections in his wallet.

Is there any possibility do burn multiple Follow-NFTs in one single transaction (batching)?
Using multicall3 from this repo could be a solution, https://github.com/mds1/multicall

üëÄ **ABOUT**
**Lens Protocol**¬†is the social layer for web3.

The Lens social graph enables creators to take ownership of their content wherever they go across the dozens of high quality apps across the Ecosystem, with new ones coming online every month.

With Lens, you can easily build social applications or integrate social features into your existing applications. For developers, one of Lens' most powerful features is that it eliminates the need to build, maintain and pay for back-end infrastructure, allowing developers to focus 100% on building the consumer experience.

Teams with as few as 1 developer are able to build polished experiences on Lens using the variety of APIs and SDKs available to builders.
